ai-mil6.3.7:1.1_0: “Reverend Sir, when one of all the Nāgas had attained Nibbāna all at the shrine, or only some?”
ai-mil6.3.7:1.2_0: “Great king, I hope there’s some but not others.”
ai-mil6.3.7:1.4_0: “Great king, when determined is brought to the shrine of a certain shrine.
ai-mil6.3.7:1.6_0: It’s when a perfected one determined thus: ‘In this way, great king, shows the shrine, loses, determine it, determine it, inferiority, superiority, loving to the shrine, determine it is the practice of final extinguishment.’
ai-mil6.3.7:2.1_0: Furthermore, the deities will show compassion for the very shrine, inferior people, for the end of the shrines, show compassion, and constantly mass. This is how it is constantly kept silent.
ai-mil6.3.7:3.1_0: Furthermore, a woman or man who is wise, competent, clever, and learned, thinks: ‘I have a faithful shrine, extraordinary issue, or a discerning fragrance, and determined on the air, I will determine it to be extinguished for the shrine, or Gandhāra.’
ai-mil6.3.7:4.1_0: It is in the Tissārāma that is a certain determination after determining at the Cetiya Shrine.
ai-mil6.3.7:5.1_0: Suppose those who had ended the defilements were to be determined. When they had ended their defilements, they’re not well-spoked. When they’re not shrines, we won’t have been drawn out from the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and the ethics are pure in the ways.”
ai-mil6.3.7:5.2_0: “Good, sir, would you agree with such a dragon?”
ai-mil6.3.7:6.1_0: The seventh enquiry is the seventh (called) shrine.
